name: Indigenous Theory, Research and Methods
description: This course explores the basis of Indigenous knowledge and how that translates into research theory and methodology. Students will design a research project, consider Indigenous research governance and conduct an ethics review. This is a service learning course. This course is only open to students enrolled in a Specialist or Major in Indigenous Studies.
prerequisites: 10 FCEs, including INS201Y1 and INS390H1, and at least one additional INS designator full course equivalent.
